coc-ai.global.model.description: Model name for coc-ai global default(see https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions)

coc-ai.global.endpointUrl.description: Model API endpoint URL for coc-ai global default

coc-ai.global.maxTokens.description: Max token for coc-ai global default, 0 for unlimited

coc-ai.global.temperature.description: Model temperature for coc-ai global default

coc-ai.global.requiresAuth.description: Whether requires authentitation for coc-ai global default

coc-ai.global.initialPrompt.description: Placeholder, do NOT change! Use engine-specific option.

coc-ai.global.tokenPath.description: Path to your coc-ai api token file

coc-ai.global.rolesConfigPath.description: Path to your roles config file

coc-ai.chat.model.description: Model name for coc-ai global default

coc-ai.chat.endpointUrl.description: Model API endpoint URL for AI chat

coc-ai.chat.maxTokens.description: Max token for AI chat, 0 for unlimited

coc-ai.chat.requiresAuth.description: Whether requires authentitation for AI chat

coc-ai.chat.initialPrompt.default:
You are a helpful code assistant
Assume that all unknown symbols are properly initialized elsewhere
Add a syntax type after ``` to enable proper syntax highlighting in fenced code blocks
coc-ai.chat.initialPrompt.description: Initial chat prompt as system role

coc-ai.chat.codeSyntaxEnabled.description: Whether highlights code block in AI chat

coc-ai.chat.populatesOptions.description: Whether polulates options to the chat header

coc-ai.chat.preserveFocus.description: Whether go back to current buffer after open chat window

coc-ai.chat.openChatCommand.description: Preset (preset_below, preset_tab, preset_right) or a custom command

coc-ai.chat.scratchBufferKeepOpen.description: Re-use scratch buffer within the vim session

coc-ai.edit.endpointUrl.description: Model API endpoint URL for AI edit

coc-ai.edit.maxTokens.description: Max token for AI edit, 0 for unlimited

coc-ai.edit.requiresAuth.description: Whether requires authentitation for AI edit

coc-ai.edit.initialPrompt.default:
You will act as a code generator.
Do not write any introduction, conclusion, or explanation.
Do not use fenced code blocks.
coc-ai.edit.initialPrompt.description: Initial edit prompt as system role

coc-ai.complete.endpointUrl.description: Model API endpoint URL for AI complete

coc-ai.complete.maxTokens.description: Max token for AI complete, 0 for unlimited

coc-ai.complete.requiresAuth.description: Whether requires authentitation for AI complete

coc-ai.complete.initialPrompt.default:
You will act as a code generator.
Do not write any introduction, conclusion, or explanation.
Do not use fenced code blocks.
coc-ai.complete.initialPrompt.description: Initial complete prompt as system role

coc-ai.tab.model.description: Model name for AI tab completion

coc-ai.tab.endpointUrl.description: Model API endpoint URL for AI tab completion

coc-ai.tab.proxy.description: Proxy for AI tab completion endpointUrl

coc-ai.tab.maxTokens.description: Max token for AI tab completion, 0 for unlimited

coc-ai.tab.maxContextSize.description: Max context size (characters) for AI tab completion input

coc-ai.tab.includeOpenBuffers.description: Whether to include content from other open buffers of the same file type as context

coc-ai.tab.temperature.description: Model temperature for AI tab completion

coc-ai.tab.requiresAuth.description: Whether requires authentitation for AI tab completion

coc-ai.tab.initialPrompt.default:
You are a code completion engine. 
Complete the following code context. 
Do not provide any explanation. 
Do not use fenced code blocks. 
Only return the completion part.
coc-ai.tab.initialPrompt.description: Initial prompt for tab completion as system role
